page.title: 08PUBLIC ISSUES IN W_U_E
page.content: TOWN COUNCILLOR{JANE WARD}, WAS ASKED BY THE CHILDREN OF BLUECOAT SCHOOL WHAT SHE FELT WERE THE ISSUES WHICH CONCERNED THE TOWNSFOLK MOST: { {PARKING}& TRAFFIC PROBLEMS WERE BROUGHT UP MOST FREQUENTLY.{LITTER}& DOG FOULING WAS ALSO MENTIONED A LOT. PEOPLE ARE ALSO CONCERNED ABOUT{ {VANDALISM, BROKEN PAVEMENTS & STREET {LIGHTING.}THE COUNCIL WAS CONCERNED ABOUT THE INCREASING HABIT OF RESIDENTS{SHOPPING}OUT OF THE TOWN WHICH LED TO THE CLOSURE OF LOCAL SHOPS _THEIR PLACE TAKEN BY BUILDING SOCIETIES ETC. THE COUNCIL WAS ALSO BECOMING WORRIED THAT THERE WERE TOO MANY OLD PEOPLE'S{HOMES}IN SOME PARTS OF THE TOWN. THE OPENING OF THE NEWLY LAID{BOWLING GREEN}ON DRYLEAZE IS BEING LOOKED FORWARD TO BY MANY PEOPLE IN THE TOWN.
